item.title: Middle East conflict: Donald Trump announces Israel's agreement to 60-day ceasefire plan; urges Hamas to take deal
item.description: Donald Trump announced that Israel has agreed to the terms for a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, mediated by the US, Qatar, and Egypt. The proposed truce aims to halt the conflict that began after the October 7 attacks and allow for broader peace negotiations. Trump urged Hamas to accept the deal, warning of further deterioration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dubai opens registration for 19th Dubai Airshow 2025: What to expect from this year's edition
item.description: Dubai Airshow 2025 runs from 17–21 November at Dubai World Central. It will feature night-time programming, exclusive networking, and a focus on innovation and sustainability. The event supports emerging talent, start-ups, and industry collaboration, reflecting the UAE’s expanding aviation and defence sectors and its goal to lead global aerospace growth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not because I have broken any law': Zohran Mamdani reacts to Trump's 'arrest threat', says voters will reply
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What’s going on with Dubai's iconic dancing fountain? it's been dry since April!
item.description: The Dubai Fountain, a major attraction, has been undergoing a five-month renovation since April 2025. Emaar, the developer, is upgrading the flooring, choreography, and lighting systems to enhance performance and aesthetics. While the fountain is paused, visitors can still enjoy archival footage displayed on construction fencing, timed with the Burj Khalifa light show.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE expands Golden Visa to attract top global talent in AI, climate and tech sector
item.description: The UAE's Golden Visa programme has shifted from attracting capital to targeting specialised talent in AI, climate tech, and finance. With 158,000 visas issued in Dubai in 2023, the focus now is on long-term value creation. Experts highlight the growing demand for skilled professionals, with expanded eligibility and flexibility making the UAE a global magnet for innovation leaders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE: Sharjah dig uncovers 80,000-year-old tools confirming 210,000 years of human presence in Arabia
item.description: Archaeologists have discovered 80,000-year-old tools at Jebel Faya in Sharjah, confirming human presence from 210,000 to 80,000 years ago. The findings reveal advanced toolmaking and adaptation to shifting climates by early Homo sapiens. Sharjah is now nominating the site for UNESCO World Heritage status, recognizing its rare and vital insight into early human survival in Arabia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Zohran Mamdani defeats Andrew Cuomo in NYC Democratic Mayoral Primary, advances to general election; could become first Muslim, Indian-American to hold post
item.description: Zohran Mamdani has officially won New York City's Democratic mayoral primary, defeating former Governor Andrew Cuomo. The democratic socialist will now face incumbent Mayor Eric Adams, Republican Curtis Sliwa, and independent Jim Walden in the general election. Mamdani's populist platform and focus on affordability resonated with voters, marking a potential shift for the Democratic party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man left without paying at Sharjah Airport: What followed was unexpected
item.description: A passenger forgot to pay for his meal at Sharjah International Airport. He offered to pay upon his return. The airport authority surprised him by settling the bill. Several staff members also offered to pay. The passenger expressed gratitude for the unexpected kindness. This incident highlights the airport's commitment to customer service. It also shows the generosity of its employees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It's a shame': Vivek Ramaswamy reacts to racial attacks against Zohran Mamdani, Usha Vance and him
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5,000 light-year-old nebula photographed in UAE: A first for Emirati astronomers
item.description: Emirati astrophotographers from the Emirates Astronomy Society have captured stunning high-resolution images of the Crescent Nebula (NGC 6888) from the UAE’s eastern mountains. Located 5,000 light-years away in the Cygnus constellation, the nebula was photographed using advanced equipment over 10 hours. The achievement highlights the UAE’s growing capabilities in deep-sky astronomy despite challenging desert conditions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Too hot to handle: Why UAE families are skipping Europe this summer
item.description: As Europe battles record-breaking heatwaves in summer 2025, UAE travellers are shifting away from traditional destinations like France, Italy, and Spain. Rising temperatures, wildfires, and health alerts are prompting families to explore cooler alternatives such as New Zealand and South Africa. Travel experts report a growing preference for sustainable, climate-conscious holiday planning among UAE residents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How UAE-based mother-son startup is using VR for emotional healing in cancer recovery
item.description: A UAE-based startup, X-Technology, is using virtual reality to support cancer patients' emotional recovery after treatment. Through immersive, mind-driven exercises, the VR platform helps users confront fear and anxiety. Founded by Nargiz Noimann-Zander, the tech integrates neuroscience and psychology, offering a safe, offline tool for mental healing. Ongoing studies show promising benefits for cancer and chronic illness patients.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE: How a 13-year-old was lured into drug use via WhatsApp: What parents should watch for
item.description: Sharjah Police rescued a 13-year-old Emirati boy addicted to drugs after receiving unsolicited WhatsApp messages. The Anti-Narcotics Department intervened swiftly following the father's plea. In 2024, they recorded 912 drug peddling cases via WhatsApp, arresting 680 suspects and blocking numerous websites. Authorities urge parents to monitor their children's online activity and promptly report any suspicious behavior to prevent drug abuse.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UAE: How passengers can perform Umrah with free transit visa during layovers in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Travelers flying with Saudia Airlines or Flynas can now perform Umrah or visit holy sites during layovers in Saudi Arabia using a special stopover visa. To qualify, passengers must register their religious visit in advance on Nusuk.sa. This visa allows a short stay, making it easier to combine transit with a meaningful spiritual journey.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
